description: Number of partitions of n into relatively prime parts. Also aperiodic partitions.
comments: Starting (1, 1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 14, ...), = row sums of triangle A137585. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 27 2008Triangle A168532 has aerated variants of A000837 in each column starting with offset 1, row sums = A000041. -  _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 28 2009
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
formula: Möbius transform of A000041. - _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 11 2000Product_{n>0} 1/(1-q^n) = 1 + Sum_{n>0} a(n)*q^n/(1-q^n). - _Mamuka Jibladze_, Nov 14 2015
example: Of the 11 partitions of 6, we must exclude 6, 4+2, 3+3 and 2+2+2, so a(6) = 11 - 4 = 7.For n=6, 2+2+1+1 is periodic because it can be written 2*(2+1), similarly 1+1+1+1+1+1, 3+3 and 2+2+2.
mathematica: p[n_] := IntegerPartitions[n]; l[n_] := Length[p[n]];g[n_, j_] := Apply[GCD, Part[p[n], j]]h[n_] := Table[g[n, j], {j, 1, l[n]}]Join[{0}, Table[Count[h[n], 1], {n, 1, 20}]](* _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 09 2012 *)a[0] = 1; a[n_] := Sum[ MoebiusMu[n/d] * PartitionsP[d], {d, Divisors[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 03 2013 *)
prog: (PARI) N=66; x='x+O('x^N); gf=2+sum(n=1,N, (1/eta(x^n))*moebius(n)); Vec(gf) \\ _Joerg Arndt_, May 11 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Corrected and extended by _David W. Wilson_, Aug 15 1996
Additional name from _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 11 2000
